intro: Parosela pogonathera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Parosela pogonathera is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its unique foliage and adaptability make it a notable species in tropical botany.
